metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4045 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Offscreen Canvas did not properly track cross-origin tainting, which could have been used to access image data from another site in violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 102.14, and Firefox ESR < 115.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
